alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 03 at 4:29PM CST until February 03 at 5:15PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Butler County in south central Alabama... Monroe County in south central Alabama... Conecuh County in south central Alabama... * Until 515 PM CST. * At 429 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles west of Vredenburgh to 8 miles northwest of Monroeville to 12 miles northwest of McCullough, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Evergreen, Frisco City, Peterman, Georgiana, Uriah, McKenzie, Castleberry, Excel, Beatrice, Repton and I65 And US 84. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central Alabama. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central Alabama.
